title: Tenga presente que este aceite es rcomendado para vehiculos Europeos, excelente en precio y calidad
description:
Valvoline SAE 5W-40 para vehículos europeos:
Como propietario de un vehículo europeo, la elección de un aceite de motor adecuado es esencial para mantener el rendimiento y la durabilidad de nuestro automóvil. Al buscar una opción confiable, decidí probar el Valvoline Aceite de motor sintético completo SAE 5W-40 después de recibir una recomendación positiva de Amazon Fit, que tiene en cuenta las especificaciones de mi vehículo.
Lo primero que me atrajo de este aceite fue su recomendación específica para automóviles europeos. Esta característica me dio confianza, ya que me aseguraba que el aceite cumplía con los estándares y requerimientos específicos de mi vehículo, lo que garantizaba una lubricación óptima y un rendimiento adecuado del motor.
La calidad del Valvoline SAE 5W-40 es notable. Al tratarse de un aceite de motor sintético completo, ofrece una excelente protección contra el desgaste y el calor, lo que es especialmente importante para los motores de alto rendimiento presentes en muchos vehículos europeos. Además, su viscosidad de 5W-40 es ideal para una amplia gama de temperaturas, asegurando una lubricación efectiva en climas fríos y calurosos.
El precio de este aceite es muy razonable en comparación con otras opciones de aceites sintéticos en el mercado. Teniendo en cuenta su calidad y recomendación para automóviles europeos, siento que estoy obteniendo un valor excepcional por mi dinero.
La propuesta de utilizar un aceite de motor Premium en intervalos, alternando con aceites intermedios, es una estrategia interesante para ahorrar dinero sin comprometer la protección del motor. Personalmente, encuentro esta idea muy atractiva, ya que me permite aprovechar los beneficios de un aceite premium como el Motul en momentos clave, mientras aún mantengo una protección adecuada a través del Valvoline SAE 5W-40 en otros intervalos.
En conclusión, el Valvoline Aceite de motor sintético completo SAE 5W-40 para vehículos europeos es una opción sobresaliente para los propietarios de automóviles europeos que buscan una lubricación de alta calidad y una protección confiable del motor. Con su recomendación específica para automóviles europeos, calidad probada y precio razonable, es una elección acertada para mantener el rendimiento y la longevidad de nuestros vehículos. La estrategia de utilizar aceites premium e intermedios en intervalos específicos también parece ser una forma inteligente de ahorrar dinero sin comprometer la salud de nuestro motor. En general, estoy satisfecho con mi elección y definitivamente continuaré usando este aceite en mi vehículo.
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2023

title: ** STJLR.03.5007 ** Valvoline European Vehicle Full Synthetic SAE 0W-30 Motor Oil
description:
This is an initial review of : Valvoline European Vehicle Full Synthetic SAE 0W-30 Motor Oil.
Used in a Ingenium I4 Diesel Engine requiring specification STJLR.03.5007
Officially the recommended oil change interval is 21000 Miles / 24 Months,
(And that is as much as saying you have a transmission filled “for life”).
On my vehicle I run a OCI of 4000 miles, that is what I’m comfortable with, I don’t want to have a stretched timing chain or having to deal with any oil / fuel dilution problems caused by DPF regeneration cycles which these engines (and other diesel can be notorious for).
The STJLR.03.5007 is very hard to find in the USA and truth be told this Valvoline oil carries a recommendation for it, NOT and approval/license, two different things.
This oil is a C3 and not a C2 the HTHS is 3.5 and not 2.9. (Not necessarily a bad thing as a C3 protects the engine better, “thicker oil film at high temperatures”, C2 supposed to give better fuel economy because of the thin oil at high temps, but yeah, water is really thin, but also would not exactly protect your engine…
So I’m completely comfortable with the C3 and have my engine well protected. So far my MPG’s are identical… averaging 45+ MPG city / highway combined average with stop start …when it works.
I compliment the oil change with a CERATEC TREATMENT of Liqui Moly which I have used in all my cars with stellar results. (I technically love Liqui Moly, but they don’t have a STJLR.03.5007 oil available for us here, contacted them for an alternative to use with no answer from the US e-mai and a negative answer from the German cust. serv., they would not be liable for using any of their other oils.
Sure you can pay top dollar for the castrol at the dealership, but overlooking the specs and the having the recommendation, I wanted to give this oil a try…
THE ENGINE RUNS EXTREMELY SMOOTH AND THE CAR SEEMS VERY VERY HAPPY WITH THIS OIL!
Know that I change it out about every 4000 miles or 6 months whichever comes first, I can’t say anything bad right now…
Remember oil is the lifeblood of your engine, if you decide to run the dealer oil or ANY other oil, these engines like short OCI’s the last oil was in there for 5000 miles (castrol/dealer oil change…EliteCare) and I feel a day and night difference with the fresh oil.
If anything changes I will update this review….
Note if you are looking at Ravenol… it shows a recommendation and not an approval just like this oil.
So here in the USA for us it’s pretty much dealer, Motul has an approved oil, but already for a while unavailable, there is the Ford mirror spec Rowe oil available, or you can buy overseas and have it shipped…
As for me, I’m comfortable with Valvoline’s recommendation, and the results in my engine,
SUPER SMOOTH, ENGINE RUNS SUPER QUIET, AND PERFORMANCE EXCELLENT.
I’m looking forward to other reviews of this specific oil in this specific setting Jaguar / Land Rover vehicles requiring STJLR.03.5007 in their INGENIUM DIESEL VEHICLE.
SO IN SHORT:
Yes, it works excellent in my car
Change oil AND filter every time (coopers fiaam is OEM)
And note that I complimented the oil change with Liqui Moly Ceratec.
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2023

title: Works well in not just Euro cars, but Japanese and American... oil is oil... Weight matters most.
description: Works well in not just Euro cars, but Japanese and American... oil is oil... Weight matters most. This is good for my wife's 2015 Honda Accord which is higher in miles, like 140k. So, a slightly more weightly oil is good for looser engine clearances. I believe the recommended is 0-30w but I buy the 5-40w for her car. The price is better than many others.
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2023

title: Highly Recommend this Oil for Higher Mileage Performance Vehicles
description: I drive a 2010 Chevy Camaro LLT with 180k miles. I looked into 5w-40 after reading that it is better for the engine than 5w-30 in higher mileage vehicles that tend to build up a lot of heat, whether that be from the engine itself, or outside temperature. I change my oil every 5000 miles give or take, and I've had 0 issues. This specific viscosity of oil is hard to come by in shops as well. Would highly recommend.
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2023
